intro: Azorella diapensioides var. denticulata, commonly known as the denticulate azorella, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains. It belongs to the Apiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically basal, forming a rosette, and are covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. Azorella diapensioides var. denticulata is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
